sub_title: Program Officer, Feminist Crisis Response and Emerging Movements at GFW         |         MA Gender and Development - IDS
summary:
Siouar Douss aspires to lead and contribute to powerful, transformative, and intersectional development work that commits to gender justice, human rights and shifting power systems through global feminist movement building.

Siouar is a gender and development practitioner, human rights defender, and feminist development professional. She holds an MA in Gender and Development from the Institute of Development Studies at the University of Sussex in the United Kingdom and is a Chevening Scholar. Siouar is dedicated to civil society movements, as she believes that civil society and development programming can be powerful agents of change, driving gender equality and enhancing social inclusion alongside governments and the private sector. In her career in development, she contributed to designing and implementing positive youth development programs, community resilience projects, and women’s rights and gender justice programming. Throughout her career, she supported human rights defenders, grassroots organizations, and the building of the feminist movement as part of her life purpose as an engaged feminist. Siouar is skilled in grant making, grant management, project management, communication, budgeting, research and monitoring and evaluation.

awards.title: Women Initiative Fellowship
awards.description: A one year program including one month trainings in USA ; participating in courses at SMU, visiting civil society organizations and Fortune 500 companies, and shadowing American mentors plus ongoing in country training to implement a personal action plan community over one year.

profile_positions.title: Program Officer, Feminist Crisis Response and Emerging Movements

profile_positions.description:
Conducting “Environment and Gender Media Analysis” Research with a focus on the most affected groups.
The research focuses on Tunisia and highlights the link between climate change and gender.
profile_positions.title: Research Consultant

profile_positions.description:
Nalafem is a Pan-African collective of feminist leaders with a mission to Foster, Embolden and Mobilize (FEM) women and girls from Africa and the diaspora. 

-Represent the collective and lead the participation of 8 young African women climate advocates at COP27
-Capacity Building in advocacy targeting climate advocates
-The official launch of the collective's 5year strategy
-Organize and facilitate roundtables in targeted African countries as a preparation step for strategy
implementation
-Supervise a team of 4
profile_positions.title: Coordinator (Consultant)
North Africa Program Officer

profile_positions.description:
USAID funded project
-	Tunisia Resilience and Community Empowerment “Ma3an” Project

-Develop technically sound intervention strategies and execution plans, in coordination with the Civic Engagement Program Manager and Senior Technical Advisor, to meet component goals and to determine operational needs.
- Oversee the entire process of implementing activities to ensure their effectiveness.
- Work closely with youth, local CSOs, partners and other stakeholders to develop a youth inclusive ecosystem that promotes youth civic engagement.
- Provide training and mentoring to youth, local partners and other stakeholders in order to strengthen local capacity to empower youth engagement in the community.
- Coordinate with local partners and other stakeholders to ensure holistic local supports for youth, including participation in strengthening youth mainstreaming awareness.
- Contribute to the design of a civic engagement strategy and manage its implementation with partners, the Program Manager, and Senior Technical Advisor.
- Work with the MEL team to provide ongoing input for monitoring and reporting on project activities.
profile_positions.title: Civic Engagement Specialist

profile_positions.description:
USAID funded projects 
-	2018 IMPACT AWARD winning “Sharekna” Project to Support Youth and Empower Local Communities
-       Tunisia Resilience and Community Empowerment (TRACE) Ma3an Programme
-Designing grants’ packages: Designing grants’ programs, writing proposals, creating budgets, developing memos
-Working closely with the local partner organizations to design, implement, and monitor activities, including grants’ activities
-Partners outreach and relationship management
-Providing technical and administrative support and facilitating communication with implementing partners to ensure timely completion of project objectives and deliverables while adhering to budget, scope, and schedule requirements
-Coordinating the project's grants accounting, compliance and risk management                                                     
-Review sub grantee budget and , prepare contracts/agreements and follow up on compliance               
-Tracking all grants, ensure grant applications and paperwork comply with the relevant rules and regulations of FHI360 and USAID, suggest corrective measures, and provide technical assistance as needed
-Support mapping communities, developing action plans and developing community resilience activities in collaboration with local partners 
-Reporting: Progress reports, implementation plans, donors reports… etc
- Producing communications outlets related to programs
-Social Media & Marketing Creating a social media marketing strategy to advance the sub-grants’ projects and activities.
profile_positions.title: Deputy Program Manager

profile_positions.description:
Support the Migrant Resource and Response Mechanism’s information campaign and remote management of mobile teams;                      
Coordinate with other departments the implementation of the Community Response Map                      
Prepare regular progress reports to be submitted to donors and Headquarters;                     
 Support the preparation of regular project narratives, concept notes, minutes of meeting as well as interim and final project reports, according to IOM and donor formats as required, and update regularly and report to donors covering all IOM activities;                       Follow up on the timely preparation, review and submission of interim and/ or final narrative reports to donors.                       
 Keep track of donor reporting requirements and submission deadlines for each project;
profile_positions.title: Reporting Consultant
Consultant in Project Management

profile_positions.description:
Our Youth Our Hope (OYOHO)  is an NGO that has the mission of unleashing the potential of Tunisia's youth. OYOHO has launched ‘forUs’: a project funded by MEPI that aims at training more than 200 youth from marginalized areas in Tunis
Project Coordination Optimizing the project’s activities 
-Increase the efficiency of the project’s beneficiaries’ personal action plans. 
-Managing the project’s logistics when needed. 
 -Identifying problems or risks and developing mitigation plans and implementing it
Capacity Building for Youth Centers  Managing and executing capacity building training for Youth Centers’ female facilitators to help them optimize the potential of their resources, strengthen their Branding and build a consistent structure and strategy for current and future staff to maximize the efficiency of their programs with Youth.  
Gender Inclusion  Ensuring the active participation of female participants in the ForUs  program through gender mainstreaming  
Identifying the gaps in terms of GESI integration and areas for further collaboration
Social Media & Marketing  Creating a social media marketing strategy to advance the brand of the organization and the organization’s projects and activities.
Outreach & Engagement    Researching and networking with local  businesses, NGOs, collectives, and offices related to the organization’s ongoing activities
-Establishing partnerships with local businesses, NGOs, collectives, and offices related to the organization’s ongoing activities
-Interacting and engaging with partners on the organization’s ongoing activities; identifying avenues for collaborative activities with partners and implementing their involvement
 -Representing the organization at networking and partner events, supplying presentations and promotional material, and presenting the materials
-Managing volunteers/interns as needed at organization events and activities
Events Management Planning and implementing events 
Reporting  Developing progress reports

volunteer_experiences.description:
I was part of a social entrepreneurship program organized by INJAZ Tunisia for 9 
months. I was the team leader of a group of young students hitting social entrepreneurship 
for the first time. We chose the drowning of sea workers as our social challenge. So, we came up with 
a new concept of a life saver equipped with a GPS to track lost workers. Actually, this product is very 
unique as it is very light and can be easily worn while working. So if an accident happens, the sea 
workers will be protected and easily rescued. Our team has participated in INJAZ Tunisia’ nationwide 
competition and won the innovation prize. My contribution in this project was a unique experience as I
was the team leader of this young initiative. I believe I acquired leadership and teamwork skills. I also 
learned how to pitch in front of an important audience. Although the social challenge we targeted was 
very strenuous, our contribution was very effective. During this experience,I discovered my 
management skills which led to achieve our common goal.  I have definitely became more eager to learn how to become a successful leader contributing in my country’s development.
